result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph M. Rowan

defendant.name: Rowan, Joseph M.
defendant.address: N14684 County Rd NN, Stanley, WI 54768

records.addlTxt: Deferred prosecution agreement hearing on August 10, 2023 at 09:30 am.

9:57 AM cases 20CM494, 20CM900, 22CF58, 22CF59 called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph M. Rowan in court with Attorney Roger Hillestad in court. Agreement has been reached. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. State moved to amend Count 2 in 22CF59 to County Ordinance Retail Theft.  

20CM900- Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1: Misdemeanor Retail Theft as part of 12 month DAGP.
20CM494- Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 1: Retail Theft as part of 12 month DAGP.
22CF58- Defendant pleads Guilty to Count 2: Misdemeanor Retail Theft as part of 12 month DAGP.

22CF59- Defendant pleads Guilty to Amended Count 2: Co. Retail Theft

Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts the pleas and withholds finding of guilty pending completion of DAGP in 20CM900, 20CM494 and 22CF58. Court finds the Defendant guilty in 22CF59.

Court orders in 22CF59: court costs and 1 bench warrant fee

Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for August 10, 2023 at 09:30 am.

(9:45 AM cases 20CM494, 20CM900, 22CF58, 22CF59 called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Joseph M. Rowan in court. Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Joseph M. Rowan.
Attorney Hillestad advises there is an agreement for a DAGP resolution but the defendant still needs to pay the DAGP fees.
Court orders the defendant must submit finger prints today before leaving the courthouse.
Hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:59 AM Cases called: 20CM494, 20CM900, 22CF58 & 22CF59 Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph M. Rowan in court.  Attorney Roger Hillestad appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

There is an offer to a DAGP. Defendant needs time to meet with coordinator and pay the fee.
Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

9:58 AM Cases called: 20CM494, 20CM900, 22CF58 & 22CF59. Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joseph M. Rowan in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Close to a DAGP agreement.
Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.

(Cases 22CF58, 22CF59, 20CM494, 20CM900 are called at 11:14 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Joseph Rowan appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Zebulon Patek. Attorney Andrew Gunderson appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants executed. Court orders bond continues in 20CM494 and 20CM900. 
Defense waives reading of the complaints in 22CF58, 22CF59. Time limits for preliminary hearing are waived in 22CF58, 22CF59. 
Pre-Trial Conference: 03/07/2022 at 2:30 PM.  Hearing: 03/30/2022 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with Woodman's.
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
(Covers 22CF58 & 22CF59)

Conditions:
No contact with Woodman's.
Defendant not to drive without a valid driver's license. 
(Covers 22CF58 & 22CF59)
